alert.note: Alert for Otero (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 08 at 4:26PM MDT until July 08 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northwestern Otero County in south central New Mexico... * Until 630 PM MDT. * At 422 PM MDT, a pair of fast moving thunderstorm outflow boundaries were racing toward each other over the Tularosa Basin. Winds of 40 to 50 mph were recorded. Blowing dust and significant reductions in visibility are likely across the Tularosa Basin. U.S. Highways 70 and 54 are expected to be impacted with dangerous driving conditions. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong winds up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 189 and 212. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 63 and 100. Locations impacted include... Tularosa, White Sands National Monument, Three Rivers, Alamogordo, La Luz, Holloman Air Force Base and Three Rivers Petroglyph Site. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
